result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrius C Townsend was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demetrius C Townsend

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demetrius C Townsend in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Demetrius C Townsend in custody.  Kathryn E. Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

As to Count 1:
Court sentences defendant to serve 150 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 150 days, concurrent to the sentence in 11CM6119, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court ordered defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges.  Defendant is ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.  Court imposed the Domestic Violence Assessment, but waived the DV surcharge.  Payment is due by 5/21/2019.  Failure to pay will result in entry of a civil judgment with tax intercept.  

As to Count 2:
Court sentences defendant to serve 150 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 150 days, concurrent to the sentence in 11CM6119, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court ordered defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges.  Defendant is ordered to provide a DNA sample, but court WAIVED the DNA surcharge as to count 2 only.  Court imposed the Domestic Violence Assessment, but waived the DV surcharge.  Payment is due by 5/21/2019.  Failure to pay will result in entry of a civil judgment with tax intercept.  

Filed: Notice of right to seek postconviction relief, pretrial incarceration credit form.
